metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000381 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The c-ares function `ares_parse_naptr_reply()`, which is used for parsingNAPTR responses, could be triggered to read memory outside of the giveninput buffer if the passed in DNS response packet was crafted in aparticular way.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000381` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libc-ares2 - 1.12.0-4
No subscription required

libnode64 - 8.1.4
nodejs - 8.1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: c-ares package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.0-4').
nodejs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.4').
